content.div:
Lady Gaga officially kicked off her Born this Way Foundation in style Tuesday, bringing out a slew of guests including Oprah Winfrey, author Deepak Chopra, American Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius and her own mother, Cynthia Germanotta, to support and discuss the foundationâ€™s main focus: self-confidence, wellbeing, anti-bullying and mentoring.

Taking place at Harvard (where the students know a thing or two about bullying and mentoring), the event served as a high-profile platform for the singer and her friends to discuss the issues at hand.

"If you have revolutionary potential, you must make the world a better place and use it," Gaga said as she officially kicked off the celebrations with a series of events at the institute of higher learning. "This is about transformative change in culture."

Germanotta will serve as president of the Born This Way Foundation.

"The goal is to challenge meanness and cruelty by inspiring young people to create a support system in their respective communities," Gags said. "I believe that human kind, as a whole, can change the world."

Winfrey, who disappointed the collegiate audience by not giving everyone a car, explained that she joined Gaga's foundation because it shared some of her core beliefs, including kindness, compassion, caring for others (not to mention a seemingly endless bank account).

As well as saying generally positive things, Gaga also promoted her new Born Brave Bus, which will serve as a rambling tailgate party for her fans.

"The more kids that I can get to come and eat hamburgers and talk outside my shows ... I feel that it will start small, but over time will be very big," Gaga said.

Watch the full event below:

link.Abstract: All you want for Christmas is pictures of pop stars? Done and done. Check out photos of Lady Gaga, David Guetta, Big Time Rush and more at Jingle Ball. The event took place at L.A. Live's Nokia Theatre on December 3, 2011.
link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga and More at L.A.'s Jingle Ball

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga was the headliner at Jingle Ball, Dec. 9 in New York City. But the event featured more pop stars than you can fit under a Christmas tree. Check out pics of Kelly Clarkson, LMFAO, Demi Lovato, Hot Chelle Rae, Pitbull, Foster the People, David Guetta and more, performing at Madison Square Garden.
link.title: Photos: Kelly Clarkson, Lady Gaga, LMFAO and More Play New York's Jingle Ball

link.Abstract: Ludacris announced plans to open his Chicken & Beer eatery in the Atlanta airport, but he's hardly the first pop star to turn restaurateur. From Lady Gaga to Jay-Z to Bon Jovi we've rounded up some celebs who've found time for menus and music.
link.title: Gallery: Pop Stars With Restaurants

entry.title: Madonna Finally Catches On To That Whole Lady Gaga Plagiarism Thing

link.Abstract: "I thought, 'this is a wonderful way to redo my song,'" The Material Woman tells 20/20 in an interview airing Friday.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: "I thought, 'this is a wonderful way to redo my song,'" The Material Woman tells 20/20 in an interview airing Friday. "I mean, I recognized the chord changes. I thought it was... interesting."
link.title: Madonna

link.Abstract: Madonna's 12th album will be called M.D.N.A. Get it? It's like "Madonna" without the vowels (and that extra letter "N"). Or is it? We've got some theories on what M.D.N.A. stands for.
link.title: What Does Madonna's M.D.N.A. Mean?

link.Abstract: From Madge to Minaj, these are the albums Dose.ca is looking forward to in early 2012.
link.title: Spring 2012 Music Preview

entry.title: Fashion in 2012: Call it the Lady Gaga Factor

link.Abstract: Shoes, baubles, makeup, hairstyles, colours and textures will all shout "look at me!" in 2012.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Hot: coloured denim Not: Mom jeans Colour, not shape, is what makes denim hot this year. This winter, look for cobalt blue, emerald green, red and, of course, tangerine. Spring will bring denim in turquoise, yellow, violet and pink. What doesn’t matter is the silhouette. Skinny or flared, high-waisted or navel-baring, take your pick, as long as it’s in colour.
link.title: Fashion predictions for 2012

link.Abstract: We're pitting celebrities against one another in a fierce fashion face-off. Vote for the star you think rocked the look best.
link.title: Fashion Face-Off: Who Wore It Better?

link.Abstract: Can you believe what we caught stars wearing this week? Rate the latest celebrity styles.
link.title: Rate the Fashions
